hotspots.label: Fried Coating
hotspots.fact: The golden-brown crispy coating is made by cooking protein in hot oil. This cooking method is called frying, and it creates a crunchy texture through a chemical process called the Maillard reaction, which also gives it that delicious golden color!

hotspots.label: Fresh Lettuce
hotspots.fact: Lettuce is a leafy green vegetable that is mostly water—about 95%! It provides important nutrients like fiber and vitamins that help keep our bodies healthy and strong.

hotspots.label: Diced Vegetables
hotspots.fact: The white onions and orange carrots are cut into small pieces to add flavor and nutrition to the meal. Raw vegetables keep more of their vitamins compared to cooked vegetables!

hotspots.label: Black Seasoning
hotspots.fact: The black specks are likely pepper or other seasonings sprinkled on top. Seasonings don't add calories or fat, but they make food taste amazing and can have health benefits!
